definitions.definition: To shut with sudden force so as to produce a shock and noise.
To put in or on a particular place with force and loud noise. (Often followed by a preposition such as down, against or into.)
definitions.example: Don't slam that trunk down on the pavement!

definitions.definition: To strike forcefully with some implement.
To strike against suddenly and heavily.
definitions.example: The boat slammed into the bank and we were almost thrown into the river.

definitions.definition: To speak badly of; to criticize forcefully.
definitions.example: Critics slammed the new film, calling it violent and meaningless.

definitions.definition: To dunk forcefully, to slam dunk.
To defeat (opponents at cards) by winning all the tricks of a deal or a hand.
To change providers (e.g. of domain registration or telephone carrier) for a customer without clear (if any) consent.
To drink off, to drink quickly.
To compete in a poetry slam.
To defeat by winning all the tricks of a deal or a hand.
